item.title: Report E-2025070500
item.description:
Report E-2025070500

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-26T18:26:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-15
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FUEL SOUTH EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 15, 2025, at 0640 Circle K reported 60 gallons of diesel fuel released from Circle K fuel carrier due to a loose hose fitting. Carolina Environmental Response Team (CERT) arrived on site and reported approximately 60-gallon diesel spill on the asphalt. CERT used granular absorbents and pad to clean up spill. CERT containerized spent absorbents and pads into two 55-gallon drums. Drums transported offsite for disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Agent of shipper dropped off one piece of cargo destined to Salt Lake City and described as Tools and Welding Equipment to CLT Cargo facility. Documents and ID verified at the counter and during screening, Screening Supervisor, Daniel Martin from Quantem Aviation Services was unable to identify some of the items contained in the shipment. He then pursued a secondary screening process, of physical search where he discovered a fire extinguisher enclosed in the metal box with other tools. The escalation process took place thereafter upon making the discovery of the item inside the box.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 23, 2025, ten (10) 5-gallon pails of UN1139 were crushed and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The impacted pails were containerized in five (5) 55-gallon drums. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect all impacted materials in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was at customer site, customer was filling totes. Customer was doing all hose connections and filling totes of ferric chloride. They were on the second to last tote, and when they picked it up it started leaking. They were able to get another tote underneath it, then started cleaning the spill. Customer takes full responsibility. Approximately 20-40 gallons of ferric chloride spilled in warehouse.
